title: The Literature of Knowledge - "Nothing at all"

content.question: The response "Nothing at all" to the question "What do you learn from Paradise Lost?" (sentence 15) is meant to

choices.label: suggest that the value of Paradise Lost is not in the knowledge it conveys
imply that the style of Paradise Lost makes the poem too difficult for most readers
criticize the notion that works of literature should serve a moral purpose
summarize the differing effects on human sensibility of children and higher literature

content.answer: suggest that the value of Paradise Lost is not in the knowledge it conveys

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Identify and explain claims and evidence within an argument.
